ISSUE.TITLE: DNS record value is too long (Google DKIM)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Following command ```bash $ now dns add example.com google._domainkey TXT "v=DKIM1; k=rsa; p=<too_many_chars>" ``` returns ```bash > Error! Unexpected error. Please try later. (Invalid `value` parameter (The maximum length is 255 characters)) ``` Apparently DNS specs don't allow strings to be longer than 255 characters. According to some SO answers (see [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36688278/unable-to-setup-dkim-txt-value-as-dns-record)), strings can be split. But the problem is that it seems impossible to do so with the command above.
